designScenario.name: Rudder
designScenario.description: The Rudder is a critical aerodynamic control surface responsible for managing an aircraft's yaw axis stability and directional control. It operates in concert with other flight control surfaces to counteract adverse yaw, maintain course accuracy during turns, and ensure responsiveness to pilot or autopilot inputs. The design prioritizes rapid actuation, precision deflection under varying load conditions, structural resilience against aerodynamic stresses, and fail-operational redundancy for enhanced safety. The system is engineered for minimal maintenance downtime and environmental durability across extreme operational envelopes.

details.description: Provide proportional deflection in response to pilot/autopilot input to effectuate yaw adjustments across all flight regimes.
Integrate with flight control computers to modulate deflection based on airspeed, altitude, and crosswind conditions.
Achieve full deflection within 30 milliseconds from command initiation during high-authority maneuvers.
Maintain deflection accuracy within ±0.05° under 200 knots indicated airspeed.
Implement dual-redundant actuation pathways with cross-channel validation to prevent single-point failures.
Execute controlled deflection reversal to neutral position within 2 seconds upon detecting actuator failure.
Withstand repeated exposure to icing conditions at -50°C and thermal cycling between -55°C and +95°C.
Maintain structural integrity after 10,000 cycles of full deflection under maximum design load.

systemComponents.name: Rudder Assembly
systemComponents.description: Primary control surface assembly responsible for generating yaw control forces through aerodynamic deflection.

subComponents.name: Aeroelastic Rudder Panel
subComponents.description: Composite skin structure optimized for low drag and flutter resistance at Mach 0.85.

subComponents.name: Ball Screw Actuator
subComponents.description: Precision linear actuator with integral position feedback to ensure repeatable deflection accuracy.

subComponents.name: Hinge Mechanism
subComponents.description: Low-friction pivot assembly with carbon fiber bearings to minimize deflection torque requirements.

systemComponents.name: Flight Control Electronics Module
systemComponents.description: Computational unit responsible for translating pilot inputs into actuator commands and monitoring system health.

systemComponents.name: Hydraulic Power Unit
systemComponents.description: Auxiliary power source providing backup actuation force in case of primary electrical system failure.

relationships.description: The rudder forms part of the integrated flight control system managing aircraft stability.
Electronic module provides actuation commands and monitors deflection position in real time.
Actuator forms integral part of the rudder's mechanical deflection mechanism.
Hydraulic system provides backup power for actuation under electrical failure conditions.

attributes.name: Max Deflection Range
attributes.description: Operating deflection limits to prevent structural overstress during aggressive maneuvers.

attributes.name: Actuation Force Capacity
attributes.description: Force output capability of the primary actuator under normal and emergency conditions.

attributes.name: Material Fatigue Life
attributes.description: Certified fatigue life for composite components under cyclic aerodynamic loading.

attributes.name: Environmental Sealing
attributes.description: Dust/water resistance rating for electronics and actuator components.

attributes.name: Deflection Hysteresis
attributes.description: Maximum allowable difference between commanded and actual deflection under steady-state conditions.

comments.body: Rudder system must achieve deflection within ±0.1° for precision turns
High-strength composite material ensures structural integrity under aerodynamic loads

rag_context: The Rudder system is designed to achieve precise yaw control with rapid actuation speed of less than 50 milliseconds. It ensures accurate directional control during turns and crosswind maneuvers with a deflection accuracy of ±0.1°. The rudder material is made of high-grade composites with a tensile strength of over 1500 MPa to withstand high aerodynamic forces. It operates within a temperature range of -40°C to +85°C and is resistant to corrosion. The aerodynamic profile is streamlined with optimized curvature for optimal airflow and minimal drag. The system emphasizes rapid response, precision in deflection, structural integrity under variable loads, and integrated fail-safe controls. It is also designed for ease of maintenance and resistance to environmental wear.
